title: Who are your three favorite champions to play, and why?
body:
What are your three favorite champions to play in League? Also, why are they in your top three? They don't need to be in meta or even good, just something you play often enough and enjoy.

Mine are as follows:

Number One: {{champion:45}} Veigar. Because it's so rewarding to farm 100 AP and think to yourself "Sweet, I have bonus AP as if I had a Rylai's", or "damn, my deathcap is gonna make my power SPIKE!". It's also pretty satisfying to stun someone for 2 seconds and kill them before they even know what happened or to save your whole team from a teamfight gone wrong with a well placed fleeing stun. I play this guy all the time, he's extremely fun to play with, albeit he's usually boring to just watch. I mean, check this out.

http://i.imgur.com/1FviIJY.jpg
That's 19/0/7 by the way ;)

Number Two: {{champion:30}} Karthus. Not very many people realize how powerful and fun this guy is, especially once he gets his RoA. His E is very strong, and with his passive he can wreck face even after death. His Q also hits like a truck lategame, talk about a fantasy. I also enjoy ulting fleeing opponents, and then regenerating Mana by killing minions as they rage at me in all chat.

Number Three: {{champion:17}} Teemo. Yes, I said I enjoy playing as Satan. There's something about going stealth in lane, and then ambushing your opponent the moment after they step on a shroom. Just having that global taunt that makes everybody wanna kill you... ah it's so satisfying when they can't.

My top 3 favorite champions to play are:

3) {{champion:90}} One of the first champs I really locked onto back when I first started playing, Malz holds a special place in my heart. I rotate through mid-lane champions a lot, but Malz is a constant comfort pick.

2) {{champion:59}} Jarvan IV was the first champ to be released after I started that I really gravitated toward. Saw the spotlight and figured he'd be a champion I'd enjoy. 3 years later, I think I was right! I always feel comfortable playing him, and will often default to him for top/jungle.

1) {{champion:21}} Picking up Miss Fortune was kind of an accident for me. I started playing her on a whim in Season 2, and found a more success with her than any other ADC. That has carried on to Seasons 3 and 4, where she's been my most-played in ranked, and just all-around favorite champion.

{{champion:112}} **Viktor**:  Viktor is by far my favourite champion in this game.  I love his whole theme, his lore, his kit, and how so many people tend to underestimate him.  With more information about the Battlecast slowly coming out, I'm becoming more intrigued as to how  Riot's going to have that story pan out (if they ever do).  Viktor was the first champion that really clicked with me, and way back when I started playing this game (about 3 years ago) a few friends warned me that he wasn't very good and he was hard (one even called him useless), but after I got a quadra in my third game with them, they stopped.  I do a lot of RPG games, and tend to drop into character after playing long enough.  Viktor is one of the few characters in any MOBA (including Smite, DotA, and (RIP) Dawngate) that has this effect on me.  Also, I'm a huge fan of Warhammer 40k, and he reminds me of a Tech-Priest.  >_>  

{{champion:111}} **Nautilus**:  I will say this first:  I don't like jungling, and it's the role I'm worst with.  Nautilus is the one champion that I actually enjoyed jungling with, and while I may never have carried with it, I always got my team fed so that I didn't have to worry.  When the preseason changes came into effect, tank-junglers were hit hard, and the few times I've played Nautilus jungle since then have been some of the toughest games I've ever done.  I don't know what made me first try it, but not too long ago I started playing Nautilus support.  It.  Is.  Fantastic.  He still has a few problems, but they're ones that all tanks are suffering from now.  His insane CC makes up for most of that though, and being in a support role just makes it easier to set up kills for my carries.  

{{champion:161}} **Vel'Koz**:  I admit, when he was released, I wasn't too interested in Vel'Koz.  Liked his Battlecast skin, but that was about it.  His kit seemed interesting, but nothing really jumped out at me.  A friend bought him directly after his release, played one game with him, and immediately started ranting about how he was a terrible champion, the worst Riot's ever designed, etc.  (Yes, he fed hard in his first game, and I've never seen him play Vel since.)  This got me curious.  I did a custom game with Vel, and really liked it.  I couldn't understand what my friend was talking about, so tried it in a normal game.  I had a lot of fun, and utterly destroyed my opponent in lane.  I've since gotten even better with him, and Vel'Koz is my number two choice in mid.  Getting a kill with a blind split-Q is amazing, and I've made quite a few enemies rage and call 'hax' on me for doing it.

He is just incredibly fun to use, and combines some of my favorite attributes of ADCs into one champion. is both very safe and poke heavy, but can dive in and burst people at the drop of a hat. I main Vi, but she isn't my favorite to play, I just happen to be good with her. My favorite champs are those who's lore I really connect with and/or I just like their personality.

1) {{champion:154}} I picked up Zac while I was watching Chuck, and he reminded me so much of Captain Awesome. I just love his overly friendly personality and how he apologizes for killing people. Also, who doesn't love launching a green blob into the middle of the enemy team? I started playing him again in the jungle a couple weeks ago and was shocked by how good of a place he's in. His first clear is up there with Vi and WW in terms of how much health you have left. Since he's been trash tier for a while, I've also found people really underestimate him.
2) {{champion:99}} Her backstory is pretty awesome, and her poke is incredible. It's also fun to abuse how broken the hitbox on her E is.
3){{champion:61}} I think Ori has the best lore in the game, hands down. The voice is perfect for the character, the lines are delivered perfectly, and the ball is fun to throw everywhere

1) {{champion:55}} Kat's been my favorite champion since before her rework (hilariously ironic: pandered to low-end players who didn't care about her, then shot the dedicated mains in the foot when she just got nerfed later on when people too lazy to use CC whined about her). Ridiculously high risk-reward because she brings absolutely zero utility to a team, so she either kills everyone or ends up as dead weight.

Pre-rework/nerf Kat still holds my 33 kill record and I doubt I'll ever pass it, given that Dominion's community is circling the drain and I dislike the stupid fun of URF-esque modes.

2) {{champion:113}} Boar Bitch for the win: very high damage for a (near-)pure tank, mobility, and lots of CC. Her rework pushed her damage into OP territory with the absurdly high %HP on her Q and her CC buffs (Riot cut her CC for some reason ...), despite the fact that she suffered from the exact same problem as before: why pick her when Cursed Touch means {{champion:32}}  will forever do more damage than her? :v Being viable for levels 4 and 5 isn't really a bragging point compared to how much he overtakes her afterwards.

And then the new jungle completely pushed her out of viability due to tank/squishy champions dying to camps and invaders like Lee Sin losing nothing.

It'd be nice to see another boost to her first clear sustain and perhaps a slight CC buff.

3) {{champion:43}}2 Every support Karma2 I see makes me warm on the inside, because that's a little more hope that solo queue will never figure out how to play her properly. As much as I disliked Riot effectively deleting Karma and replacing her with Karma2, I'll take her hilariously powerful Q as compensation for the relaunch ruining her shield and RE (mantra bonus not applying bug still not fixed ...). Take her mid or top, stomp on or outfarm anyone who can't outpoke you, and forever win any push or poke contests for the rest of the game.

Special Mentions:
{{champion:28}} Used to be my favorite champion in the game until repeated nerfs destroyed her.
I absolutely loved what she looked like post-rework: a {{champion:92}} -esque light fighter hypercarry which actually pays for late game power with a weak early game, so long as you avoided the Sheen trap build (Trinity Force ruins Q's AD ratio and E's AS steroid) and built a bit of bulk to make up for her horrific base survivability (FH: mana, much-needed CDR, and a ton of armor!). Take her jungle or top, farm up and get kills, then split push or aspire to the glory of the 1500 ultimate shield. Unfortunately, Riot's rework failed to balance her W properly, her ult does next to zero damage late game against MR/L runes or Spirit Visage/GA spam, and Riot decided to nuke her entire kit from orbit when people discovered that DFG + AP burst + stealth = cheese instagib. Instead of, y'know, addressing that DFG is a god-awful item for this game and deleting it.

And then the new jungle completely pushed her out of viability due to tank/squishy champions dying to camps and invaders like Lee Sin losing nothing.

1. Number 1 - Leona
Ah heck yes. I'm a support player almost since the first time i touched the game, and this is by far my favorite. I love the feeling of being in lane and knowing "I'M THE BOSS". She's mechanically pretty simple, which is good for me, and her whole kit feels so well designed in terms of giving me clear, singular goals in fights. Nothing makes me happier than seeing a squishy support on the other team and knowing i'm just gonna go ham on that fool.

2. Number 2 - Lissandra
I hated this champ when she was first introduced, and then I played with her. i don't even own her (not much of a mid player tbh) but every time she's free I spam this champ. I love the idea that I'm a mage who dives into the other team and unleashes hell. She's like the "man mode" of mid laners - yeah i'm squishy, yeah it's dangerous, but screw you I'm going in and murdering fools.

3. Number 3 - Singed
Trololololol. I'm not very good with him, but I love this dude. His play pattern is utterly unique and the few times you really get a chance to completely troll charge the other team, it's so worth it. Spam laugh, hit R, and activate poison trail. PROFIT.

I think mine would be...

1. {{champion:69}} I adore poison everything in games and a poison DOT mage is perfect for me. Her ult is also incredibly fun (if somewhat frustrating gameplay-wise) - turning people to stone just with your gaze is fabulous. And the rare occasion where it ends up in killing someone who was cocky enough to engage on you with low health is amazing. Twin Fang is also an exceptionally unique move. I think the rework has a lot of problems and very much prefer Old Cass as a champ but it's hard to ruin something as perfect as a snake lady.

2. {{champion:134}} What can I say I love mid lane burst mages. Syndra's incredibly fun to me, I love manipulating her spheres, her quotes, her fabulous outfits (all her skins are wonderful) and her ultimate. Some will say her ultimate is unskilled for being point-and-click but it's not completely effortless for obvious reasons and there's not much I find more rewarding than seeing your spheres shooting towards someone and killing them. That said it's very anti-climactic when they don't.

3. {{champion:127}} I don't play Lissandra much because I've yet to really pay much attention to top lane, mostly focusing on support and mid. And I don't like the sound of Lissandra mid. That said, on the rare occasion that I do get to play her I adore her. Her ultimate condemning a carry to death is just glorious and everything else about her has its perks too.
